title: (x) Guru - Architype Renner (tilted 'G') {Yves}
content:
Anyone knows what this font is called:   
   
 [http://users.pandora.be/eforum/archive/archive1/guru.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219045008/http:/users.pandora.be/eforum/archive/archive1/guru.gif)   
   
Thanks
author: anonymous

comments.content:
It looks like the UC 'G' has simply been tilted, so that'd   
make it a Futura-like font, probably [The Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219045008/http:/www.thefoundrystudio.co.uk/)'s version   
of Paul Renner's original design. Let me look it up.

Yep, I think it might well be [Architype Renner](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219045008/http:/www.on-idle.com/foundry/foundry_architype_1/renner.html).   
Whaddayathink?

Yep, i think it's the same one, You know where i can download it?   
   
Thanks Yves

Hmmm... their site says:   
   
_All the fonts are available in PostScript Type 1 for the   
Macintosh fully compatible with Adobe Type Manager,   
and in PostScript and TrueType for the PC._      
   
but there is no inkling of a clue where you can purchase   
licenses for their fonts. Talk about bad communication.   
Does anybody know through which channel you can buy   
Foudrytypes?

Stephen, what's that suppose to mean?! It's friggin' way   
too early in the morning for you! Go back to bed! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219045008im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
